source.description: eProcurement Ontology (ePO) by Publications Office of the EU

description._: Role of an Agent that provides centralised purchasing activities and, possibly, ancillary purchasing activities for other Buyers. Additional Information: In Public Procurement the Role of Central Purchasing Body is carried out by a Contracting Authority for other Contracting Authorities. Contracting Authority procuring activities conducted on a permanent basis, in one of the following forms:[...](b) the award of Public Contracts or the conclusion of Framework Agreements for works, supplies or services intended for Contracting Authorities;

parentClass.description: Parent class in the inheritance hierarchy

description._: A financial resource used to support the Procurement. Additional Information: In the context of EU, Funds can be divided into programmes, actions and projects. Examples of EU funds are: the European Structural and Investment Funds, European Social Fund (ESF), the Connecting Europe Facility (CEF) programme, or the ISA2 programme and its actions (e.g. Action 2016.05 European Public Procurement Initiative, which supports the eProcurement Ontology under sub-action 3). Funds may change between the lot and the contract, for example in the case of an emergency crisis, a contract may be financed by a budget that was not foreseen in the call.
Technique that establishes the terms governing Contracts to be awarded during a given Period, in particular with regard to Price and, where appropriate, the Quantity envisaged.

parentClass.description: Parent class in the inheritance hierarchy

description._: A Contract resulting from using a Dynamic Purchasing System Technique or Framework Agreement Technique.

parentClass.description: Parent class in the inheritance hierarchy

description._: Public Procurement that contributes to achieving pressing policy goals. Additional Information: Specific strategic goals could be, for example, Environmental Protection, innovation, job creation and the development of small and medium enterprises. The subclasses are given by the choices in BT-06 Strategic Procurement. Based on https://legalinstruments.oecd.org/en/instruments/OECD-LEGAL-0411 (see paragraph on "background information".
A Role of an Agent that attempts to resolve a dispute between different Agents and come to an agreement.

parentClass.description: Parent class in the inheritance hierarchy

description._: Role of a public or private body which offers ancillary purchasing activities on the market. Additional information: "Ancillary Purchasing Activities" means activities consisting in the provision of support to purchasing activities, in particular in the following forms: (a) technical infrastructure enabling Contracting Authorities to award Public Contracts or to conclude Framework Agreements for works, supplies or services; (b) advice on the conduct or design of public Procurement Procedures; (c) preparation and management of Procurement Procedures on behalf and for the account of the Contracting Authority concerned; This would be equivalent to the concept of 'ProcuringEntity' in OCDS: 'The Entity managing the Procurement, which may be different from the Buyer who is paying / using the items being procured'.

parentClass.description: Parent class in the inheritance hierarchy

description._: Approach whereby Buyers seek to procure by fulfilling social objectives. Additional Information: Socially Responsible Public Procurement (SRPP) - ‘SRPP’ means Procurement Operations that take into account one or more of the following social considerations: employment opportunities, decent work, compliance with social and labour rights, social inclusion (including persons with disabilities), equal opportunities, accessibility design for all, taking account of sustainability criteria, including ethical trade issues and wider voluntary compliance with corporate social responsibility (CSR), while observing the principles enshrined in the Treaty for the European Union (TFEU) and the Procurement Directives. See Article 18 and Annex X Directive 2014/24.

parentClass.description: Parent class in the inheritance hierarchy

description._: A collaborative enterprise that is carefully planned to achieve a particular aim.

Role of an Agent procuring activities conducted on a permanent basis in the form of the award of Public Contracts or the conclusion of Framework Agreements for works, supplies or services intended for other Buyers. Additional Information: In Public Procurement the Role of Awarding Central purchasing Body is carried out by a Central Purchasing Body for other Contracting Authorities.

parentClass.description: Parent class in the inheritance hierarchy

description._: Relation indicating the number of the Transport Handling Unit.
The lowest received tender value for the procurement. Additional Information: This corresponds to section II.1.7.2. according to Regulation (EU) 2015/1986.
Relation showing that an Organization can supply an Evidence with regard to the fulfilment of non-discriminatory criteria or the rules applied in order to reduce the number of participants.
does Not Require Selection Criterion Type

The source country of the product or service. Additional Information: The country of origin can be provided by the buyer as a requirement or by the tenderer information of the item to be provided. The codelist to be used is at-voc:country which is available at http://publications.europa.eu/resource/dataset/country
Relation to the proof of conformance.

The obligation or possibility for tenderers to submit variants or not. Additional Information: Variants are alternative ways to fulfil the buyer's needs as opposed to solutions indicated in the procurement documents. eForms: Whether tenderers are required, allowed or forbidden to submit tenders which fulfil the buyer's needs differently than as proposed in the procurement documents. Additional Information: Further conditions for submitting variant tenders are in the procurement documents.
A monetary amount representing the financial capability of the Organization. Additional information: Used to represent the general Turnover of the Organization (for statistical purposes).
The document to which a document is associated.
The source country of the product or service. Additional Information: The country of origin can be provided by the buyer as a requirement or by the tenderer information of the item to be provided.
The Contractor must be a Winner.
The amount of space that is required without the packaging.
Relation indicating a ProcedureTerm has a LotGroup.
The identifier used for tracking the Goods Item. Additional information: An example is the EPC number used in RFID.
Relation to indicate that a given type of Contract is a consequence of a given LotAwardOutcome.
An unique identifier for referencing the direct debit mandate, assigned by the Payee.
Relates to submission for the given competition, either at Lot level or Mini-Competition level.
Location delivery area where the Item can be ordered to the given price.
Specification of the hazardous nature of an item according to a classification schema. Provides detail of the classification and nature of a hazardous item.
The manufacturer's identifier for the item.
The amount of space that is required including the packaging.
The value of procured supplies that have used a particularly advantageous opportunity available for a very short time at a value considerably lower than normal market prices.
The identifier assigned to a specific batch of the produced Item.
An identifier assigned by the Buyer used for internal routing purposes.
The forecasted time period given by the Despatcher to provide the goods and services.
An identifier for an object on which the invoice is based, given by the Seller.
Indicates under which regulation a notice is created.
The requirement to which the concept meets.
The highest received tender value for the procurement. Additional Information: This corresponds to section II.1.7.3. according to Regulation (EU) 2015/1986.

Funding is provided either completely or partially by a Fund. Additional information: Funds may change between the lot and the contract, for example in the case of an emergency crisis, a contract may be financed by a budget that was not foreseen in the call.
Relation indicating the Location of the Despatch of the Goods Items to be delivered.

The value offered by the Tenderer for a Lot. Additional Information: This value is normally the one awarded for a winning Tender Lot. In case of negotiated procedures the original financial value may be reviewed and the offer updated.
The information about subcontracting that must be indicated in the tender.
An agent involved in an evaluation board.

Reference to a previous procedure. Additional Information: In the case of Direct Award Terms, this property points to a previous Procedure justifying the use of Direct Award without a prior publication.

Reference to one or more Lots in a previous procedure. Additional Information: In the case of Direct Award Terms, this property points to a previous Procedure justifying the use of Direct Award without a prior publication.

The maximum value which can be spent through all the framework agreements announced in this notice, including options and renewals of contracts. Additional information: The value provided is a threshold value that implicity means that it cannot be exceeded however it may not be reached during the execution of a contract. The Framework Agreements in a CAN are to be traced back and added to provide this value.
The expected amount of time between the order and delivery of an item.

The value of the procurement provided by the Award Decision. Additional Information: Different cases of awarded values may refer to a lot, the global value of the procedure, or of a combinatorial value of a group of lots. In the case of framework agreements and dynamic purchasing systems this refers to the maximum awarded value.
refers To Lot Group Award Information
Reason for not accepting electronic information.
The measurement of the depth. Additional Information: The width is the shorter side between the length and the width.
Relation indicating the Purpose of a concept.
has Total Accounting Currency Tax Amount
The Monetary Value declared for statistical purposes.
The monetary amount to which the multiplier factor is applied in calculating the amount of this allowance, charge or tax.
The Winner must be a Tenderer.
The Notice was designed in accordance with the given legal basis. Additional Information: This Notice can be used for Procedures which do not have the same legal basis. This holds for standard forms.
The maximum number of orderable units that can be ordered according to details provided in the catalogue line, such as price.
Entrusts ancillary purchasing activities to ProcurementServiceProvider.

Explanation of why a contract was modified. The codelist to be used is at-voc:modification-justification which is available at http://publications.europa.eu/resource/dataset/modification-justification

A forecast of the value of the procurement before competition. Additional Information: Different cases of estimated values may refer to a lot, the global value of the procedure, or of a combinatorial value of a group of lots. The forecast is calculated by the buyer and covers all revenues whether coming from the buyer or third parties. See for example recital (19), Article 5 of Directive 2014/24/EU and other articles from the rest of Directives about procurement. In the case of framework agreements and dynamic purchasing systems this refers to the maximum estimated value.

Amount of the Tender with the lowest value. Additional Information The value must correspond to an admissible tender. For example, tenders compliant with the procurement document requirements, not having an abnormally low price or cost, etc.
The estimated value of a single subcontract.
No definition. Waiting on CCCEV alignment.
The language translation(s) in which the instances of the given concepts are available. These linguistic versions are not an official translation, they are provided only for information.
Relation indicating an Evidence that supports the Response.
Relation indicating a SubmissionTerm has a TenderProcessor.
Additional type of acquisition taken into consideration in the contract.
The identifier of the the Consignment given by the Despatcher.
Relation showing that an Organization can supply an Evidence with regard to the payment of social security contributions and taxes.
The total mass of goods including the packaging.
Relation indicating an AccessTerm has a ProcurementProcedureInformationProvider.
Relation indicating a ProcedureTerm has a Mediator.
Relation indicating a ContractTerm has a Period.
The general identifier assigned to the concept based on a standard scheme.​ Additional information: For example the GTIN scheme (Global Trade Item Number).
The identifier assigned to the specific instance of the produced concept.
Language in which the submitted information is to be expressed.

The awarded value of all lots announced in this notice, including options and renewals. Additional information: The values of the individual Lots awarded under a framework agreement and mentioned in this notice are included. The values of the individual lots announced in a CAN are to be traced back and added to provide this value.
results From Mini Competition Award Outcome

The principal sectoral area in which an organisation operates. Additional information: The activities associated with buyers are derived from the top level of the Classification of the functions of the government (COFOG) from the United Nations Statistics Division. The activities associated with buyer are derived from sectors explicitly falling within the sectoral directive (2014/25/EU Art. 8 - Art. 14).
provides Procurement Documents In Official Language
specifies Clean Vehicle Directive Vehicle Category
Offers information about an instance of a concept.
The identifier of the Order given by the Seller. Additional Information: This identifier is different than the identifier of the Order given by the Buyer and it is useful for internal purposes.
The classification of the selection criteria.
The Quantity of non-despatched Goods Items.
Relation indicating a ReviewTerm has a ReviewProcedureInformationProvider.
Relation indicating that a Criterion contains a Criterion that is specific to a given Member State.
An identifier for an object on which the invoice line is based, given by the Seller. Additional Information: It may be a subscription number, telephone number, meter point etc., as applicable.
The identifier of the Transport Means.

The legal basis under which the procurement procedure takes place. Additional Information: For example European Directives or Regulations, national laws etc. The recommended code list is the example for the legal basis at the European level.
The reason why data is not published.
The extent to which electronic catalogues may be used in tenders.
The identifier of a part of the Transport Means.

Relation indicating the instance of a Procurement Object that is planned. Additional Information: The properties of the Procurement Object that is foreseen should be read as foreseen properties. For example, Procedure isSMESuitable should be read as Procedure foreseesToBeSMESuitable. For example, Procedure isFundedBy should be read as Procedure foreseesToBeFundedBy.
Relation indicating a ContractTerm has a specific place of performance.
The horizontal measurement. Additional Information: The length is the longer side between the length and the width.
The general identifier assigned to the concept as defined by the Buyer.​
Relation indicating a ParticipationRequestTerm has a ParticipationRequestReceiver.
The Quantity that has been sent.
Relation indicating a ContractTerm has a SubcontractingTerm.
Relation indicating a ReviewTerm has a Reviewer.
Relation indicating a Dynamic Purchase System has an estimated Duration.
The method to interpret the threshold value as minimum or a maximum.
The general identifier assigned to the concept as defined by the Manufacturer. ​
Qualified value of the property, which is defined in a classification scheme. Additional Information: For example, the (0173-1#02-AAA026#007) drilling diameter of an item has value of 12 inches.
An explanation about the reasons why some procurement documents are restricted.
Provides legal constraint on the Contractor.
Relation indicating a ParticipationRequestTerm has a ParticipationRequestProcessor.
The minimum quantity of an item that is guaranteed by the seller to be delivered.

The expected payments made by the buyer to the economic operator awarded the concession that are not directly related to the use of the concession. <u>Additional Information:</u> For example the public buyer pays a yearly fee to provide a ticketing solution to the public. The fee the public pays for every ticket sold through the solution is not included in this estimation but in the estimation of the user concession revenue.

Explanation as to if and/or when information of the persons to carry out the contract is to be provided. The codelist to be used is at-voc:requirement-stage which is available at http://publications.europa.eu/resource/dataset/requirement-stage
refers To Contract To Be Modified
has Approximate Group Framework Agreement Value
The relation indicating until when a tender instance is applicable.
The epo:OrganisationGroup epo:leadBy org:Organization was implemented to be used in case of an Economic Operator Group.
The predetermined monetary value charged in addition to the price.
The number of people hired by the Organization.
has Group Framework Agreement Maximum Value
The place of the AgentInRole in the procurement is expressed by a ProcurementObject.
Relation indicating a Contract has a Duration.
Relation indicating a SubmissionTerm has a TenderReceiver.
Relation indicating the Certificate that the information refers to.
A universally unique identifier for an instance of this document.

The category of the business depending on number of employees and turnover. Additional information: See Commission Recommendation of 6 May 2003 concerning the definition of micro, small and medium-sized enterprises.
Relation indicating the submission of a tender by an economic operator.

Relation indicating that an Organization plans to have a Subcontractor. Additional information: In eForms, in a Result Notice, the foreseen Subcontractors in a Tender are associated to the Organization that proposes the Subcontractors. The Subcontractor is associated to the Organization, rather than the Tenderer, so that, in the case of multiple Organizations being a Tenderer, it is clear to which Organization the proposed Subcontractor is associated.
The identifier of the currency as in the standard code list used.
The country in which the Person was born.

A role of any natural person(s) who ultimately owns or controls the organisation or on whose behalf a transaction or activity is being conducted. Additional Information: This role is defined in the directive EU 2015/849 and it's beyond the scope for public eProcurement domain.
Relation indicating a ProcedureTerm has a BudgetProvider.
The estimated revenue coming from the use of the concession. Additional Information: Revenues are for example fees and fines. For example, the fees and fines coming from the cars using a motorway.

Amount of the Tender with the highest value. Additional Information The value must correspond to an admissible tender. For example, tenders compliant with the procurement document requirements, not having an abnormally low price or cost, etc.
Explanation as to whether a dps is used and by whom. The codelist to be used is at-voc:dps-usage which is available at http://publications.europa.eu/resource/dataset/dps-usage
Relation indicating the Certifier responsible for providing the ItemCertificate. Additional Information: Certifier is a role played by an organisation.
Reveals the winner to whom the tender award outcome is attributed.
The method to interpret the fixed value as pertaining to a total or unit.
Relation indicating an AccessTerm has a CatalogueProvider.
The number of units required. Additional Information: The quantity needs to go along with the unit.
provides Procurement Documents In Unofficial Language
The label type such environmental, quality, social etc.
States the measures to be taken after a review procedure.
The monetary value of a prize, if any, for the winner (or runners-up) of the design contest.
Relation indicating that the Response replies to a question.
Explanation as to whether a procurement may be reserved for the participation of certain types of organisation.
Relation indicating an AccessTerm has a CatalogueReceiver.
Relation indicating an AccessTerm has an OfflineAccessProvider.
An unique banking reference identifier of the Payee or Seller, assigned by the Payee or Seller bank.
An identifier for the account to be debited by the direct debit.

The estimated value to be spent within the Framework Agreement(s). Additional information: In the case of an Award Decision for a Lot, this relation represents the estimated value for the awarded Framework Agreement. In the case of a Notice, this relation represents the estimated value for all Framework Agreements covered by the Notice.

Geopolitical zone where the contract can be executed. Additional Information Used for setting restrictions that cannot be established with one country code or a geographical zone identifier (like NUTS), because they have a broader scope (geographical, economic, political, other).
Indicates whether the lot is awarded, not awarded or still open.

The form of framework agreement used in a procurement procedure. Addition information: A concept to distinguish the different types of framework agreement, which are: 1. Framework agreement without reopening of competition, 2. Framework agreement with reopening of competition, or 3. Framework agreement partly without reopening of competition.
The requirements as to what extent electronic submission is allowed.
The identifier of the the Consignment given by the Consignee.

A category that indicates the right of an Organisation to play the role of a buyer. Additional Information: The category also effects the rules that the buyer has to abide to within the public procurement procedure.
The net quantity of the item that is contained in each consumable unit, excluding any packaging materials.
Relation indicating a Contract has an estimated Duration.
has Unknown Usage Of Selection Criterion Type
Relation indicating a ProcedureTerm has an information provider.
The time period when the Despatcher picks-up the Goods Items to be delivered.
Relation indicating a DesignContestRegimeTerm has a Prize.
Provides legal constraint on the Buyer.
Relation indicating the number of the Goods Items.
is Executed By Procurement Service Provider
The quantity at which the net monetary value applies.
has Launch Framework Agreement Maximum Value
An identifier for the payment service provider where a payment account is located.
List of reasons for using a procedure which allows awarding contracts directly without publishing a notice.
relates To E Form Section Identifier
The relation indicating until when a given instance of a concept is applicable.
Relation indicating which label the certificate is about.
A unique identifier of the financial payment account, at a payment service provider, to which payment should be made.
A categorisation of the steps in which the Notice is used.
The area of the Consignment in meters divided by the width of the truck, which is considered to be 2.4 meters.
Explanation as to whether accessibility Criterion are used or not.
The relation indicating until when a Catalogue Line instance is applicable.
The general identifier assigned to the concept as defined by the Seller.​
Relation indicating a ContractTerm has a PaymentExecutor.

A role of any natural person(s) who ultimately owns or controls the organisation or on whose behalf a transaction or activity is being conducted. Additional Information: This role is defined in the directive EU 2015/849 and it's beyond the scope for public eProcurement domain.
The buyer in charge of the procedure.
Relation indicating the period to which the Response shall apply.

Whether economic operator-related information can be supplemented even after the submission deadline. Additional Information This is specific to the information on the economic operator and not the actual offer. This does not apply to the requests for clarification.
has Preferred Language For Procurement Document
specifies Clean Vehicle Directive Contract Type
The total mass of goods without the packaging.
The language(s) in which the instances of the given concepts are officially available. These linguistic versions are equally legally valid.
The requirement the tender must meet with regard to subcontracting parts of the contract.
has International Procurement Instrument Exception Information
